author: Andreas
content:
Hmm ... Bokeh filter :-? Nope. I use liberally applied gaussian blurs lately, especially in my b+w process, but otherwise, no. I'll have a look at it.

Well, I just had. Some effects look easy and useful like the T/S on portraits, other seem to need tedious selections, and then you still won't have the subtle sharpness falloff on foreground objects, not to speak of fine detail on hair, etc. Of course one can do that, but I guess it's not for me.
